title: Complacency and Missteps Deepen a Covid-19 Crisis in India
description: The new wave will hurt global efforts and vaccine supplies, experts say. Researchers are scrambling to assess whether new coronavirus variants are playing a role in India.

title: Election caused surge in COVID-19 cases, govt taking strict measures now: Kerala Health Minister KK Shailaja

title: 3,648 new cases of Covid-19 reported in West Bengal

title: Covid-19 second wave: Mumbai to keep all private vaccination centres shut till Monday
description: Maharashtra Covid-19 cases update: Maharashtra reported 58,993 new coronavirus cases on Friday, which took its caseload to 32,88,540, while 301 deaths due to the infection pushed the toll to 57,329, the health department said. There are 5,34,603 active cases in the state with total recoveries standing at 26,95,148.

title: Not even fear of Covid-19 can disrupt protest, say agitating farmers
description: With multiple health camps at these protest sites, immediate medical assistance is always at the farmers' disposal in case a protestor develops symptoms like fever or breathlessness.

title: Bloomberg - Are you a robot?
COVID-19: These are India’s worst affected states with the highest number of infections
description: As of Friday morning (April 9), the total number of COVID-19 cases stood at 1,30,60,542 and 1,67,642 total deaths in India.India recorded 1,31,968 new COVID-19 cases and 780 fatalities in the last 24 hours.Maharashtra tops the list of most Coronavirus-affected states with 32,29,547 confirmed cases and 5,21,317 active cases.The overall number of COVID-19 cases in India has surpassed the 13 million mark and recorded 1,67,642 fatalities, so far.India has recorded 1,31,968 new COVID-19 cases and 780 new fatalities in the last 24 hours, continuing to cross the 1-lakh mark in daily numbers of active cases.Maharashtra tops the list of most Coronavirus-affected states in India with 5,21,317 active cases and total 57,028 deaths, so far.India is the third most affected country in the world with 1,30,60,542 COVID-19 cases and 1,67,642 fatalities.These are top 10 most Corona-affected states in India with highest number of COVID-19 cases:

description: The plea forms part of petition seeking to debar campaigners and candidates, permanently or for a sufficiently long period, who repeatedly violate the mandatory COVID-19 protocols.

title: Bengal doctors’ forum seeks curbs on political rallies, warns of Covid-19 surge
description: The eight-phase polls in Bengal will end on April 29. On an average, at least two dozen big rallies and roadshows are held on a day by top leaders and campaigners of the contesting parties. The number of smaller meetings and processions defies count.

cent polling during the third phase of polling on April 6 held  in 31 assembly constituencies spread across its three  districts

title: Data shows drastic fall in Covid-19 tests is helping Bengal, Assam keep their numbers low
description: Since January, poll-bound states of Assam and West Bengal have drastically reduced the number of Covid-19 tests conducted daily. This has ensured that despite massive political rallies, the states don't show a surge in Covid-19 cases.

West Bengal's COVID-19 caseload

title: West Bengal reports 462 new COVID-19 cases; 2 more deaths
description: West Bengal on Wednesday (March 24) reported 462 new COVID-19 cases taking the toll to 5,81,865. According to the state health bulletin, 2 people died in a single day in the state taking the toll to 10,312.

title: Elections at Doorstep, Bengal Fighting Losing Battle Against Covid. TMC Accuses Poll Panel of Laxity
description: With assembly elections right on the corner in West Bengal, an internal survey conducted by the state’s health department has found that the coronavirus situation in 19 districts is "quite grim" as these places are seeing a steady rise in infections.

title: COVID-19: Second wave may last up to 100 days, says SBI report
description: Considering the number of days from the current level of daily new cases to the peak level during the first wave, India might reach the peak in the second half of April.
